Elliotte Harold wrote:
> Mike Schinkel wrote:
> > I believe that the market doesn't care about that level of detail, 
> > only academics and standard committees care to that extent. 
> > I believe the market cares about what works for them to 
> > achieve their specific goals.
> 
> I understand what you're saying, but I don't think you got 
> me. In this case it is my contention that following the 
> specifications leads to greater efficiency and greater 
> profits. Companies so incompetent that they cannot manage a 
> firewall or proxy server will be beaten by companies that 
> can. Precisely because the market prefers competent, 
> profitable, efficient companies, the pointy-haired will be weeded out.
> 
> We're not advocating following the spec for the spec's sake. 
> We're advocating following the spec because it works better 
> than not following it.

I generally agree with you in the long term, but not in the short term. The
market won't reward many companies fast enough, so we have the chicken & egg
problem.  If they did reward them quickly, we'd have no problem with people
not following standards, right?
